website_summaries.verdict: Though many consumers are satisfied with their technology, "bugs" exist that need to be worked out – frustrating considering the high price tag.
pros: Easy to set up and control with the free Kasa app on your device
Compatible with Alexa and Google Assistant
Has "away mode" for control when not at home
Doesn't require a hub – just WiFi
cons: Occasionally doesn't respond to Alexa and drops network connection
Somewhat bulky when plugged into an outlet, and not compatible with all face plates

customer_reviews.title: From good to garbage in about 4 months...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bunch of these. I was pleased with them at first - setup was pretty straightforward, and the Alexa integration was easy. Flash forward about 4 months or so: almost all of these are now failing. Specially, they will lose connection to my WiFi. Unplugging them and plugging them back in will sometimes fix the problem, but not for long. I did a factory reset on the 6(!) of these that I have that are failing, and upgraded the firmware. The next day they’re all failing again with the same issue. Unhappy. I’d recommend avoiding unless / until TP-Link can fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sydtech

customer_reviews.title: Cannot connect to Alexa
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I already had three light bulbs and two plugs from them that work with Alexa. I noticed that they were not getting as many good reviews as when I bought the first time, but I thought that these would work just as well and be easier to set up since I already had the app. WRONG! It keeps giving me the error “Cloud send cmd failed” Have emailed the company twice and got no response. It took longer than I thought to finish the remodel of the kitchen and I have had them too long to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Connie S.

customer_reviews.title: They don't care if it works with Alexa or NOT - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Hardware seems to be great. Service is AWFUL! Stay away if you like a smart home. Randomly drops off from Alexa. Then you have to fight and spend days attempting to get it to work with Alexa again. Reading the Net you find that everybody is having this issue and TP-LINK doesn't care - they say if it responds to the KASA app then you're on your own - very poor. They are only interested in selling hardware and not interested in providing a qualiy product and supporting it correctly. I have six kasa/tp-link devices and I'm throwing them away and going with Z-wave products that I know work and I don't have to worry about such poor support.
customer_reviews.author: Uranium Steel

customer_reviews.title: Constantly drop off network, only support 1 Google assistant account.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these primarily for the size, and they seem to work alright... until they completely drop off of the network and require me to go unplug and plug them back in to reset it. This might be an artifact of wireless channels changing on my network or something, but I shouldn't need to think about that. My Belkin WeMo plugs don't have this problem. Additionally Kasa only lets you link an account to one Google account for Assistant use (another limitation Belkin's software doesn't have). I'll be buying some adapters to make a WeMo fit where I need it and discontinuing use of these as they're unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Howard

customer_reviews.title: Keeps going off-line
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I have a number of the larger tp-link outlets and am very happy with them. I got these because they are smaller and don’t cover the entire outlet. Unfortunately they go off line at least a couple of time a week require resetting which negates the whole idea of a “smart home”! Stick with the larger TP-link outlets, they never go off-line.
customer_reviews.author: Motorhome Mama

customer_reviews.title: We own you and your first born - at least according to their T&Cs (well, not really - but close!)
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even get to complete the install. While the switch looks and feels nice, once I read T&Cs where they claim ownership of every piece of data, to do with as they please, when they please and under conditions they won't even tell me when they publish them, I decided this was not the product for me. It's really odd that you need to have a cloud account to setup devices to your own local area network and it's on this network alone control of the devices will happen. Well, there are more alternatives out there - so I'll look for another option that doesn't require an account signup to continue.
customer_reviews.author: P. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Mini is ultimately useless compared to the traditional smart plug.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well for less than a month. I thought somehow the wifi signal didn't reach the plugs (even though nothing had changed; location of the plugs, location of the router and items that may interfere), but when I swapped my minis with the traditional smart plugs the traditional smart plugs worked butt he minis still did not (new location is 6 feet away). After numerous attempts to connect and setting up the mini, the mini is ultimately useless. Tried manual set up several times as well. I do not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shimon H.

customer_reviews.title: Smart Surge protector not so smart
customer_reviews.text: Got the product set up. I've done these a lot over the last 3 years so not much problem there. However, it is not very responsive with Alexa at all. Only works about 50% of the time. Most of the time Alexa just says, "Okay" and nothing happens. You have to manually open of the SmartLife app to turn it off or on. I would highly recommend you look at getting the TP-Link smart surge protector.
customer_reviews.author: James Meadows

customer_reviews.title: Good, while it lasted ...
customer_reviews.text: Total failure after seven months of seemingly good performance. My smart mini plug stopped responding to my on/off schedules. Bad hardware? Bad app? I can't tell and since I don't have time to spend trying to fix the problem, I bought the similar Anker product. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Faithful

customer_reviews.title: Google Assistant works great with it whether it's Home, Chromecast, your Phone, your Chromebook, or whatever else it's on.
customer_reviews.text: These things are invaluable. I first tried a LIFX bulb (smart bulb) product by itself, which is pretty cool. But it lacks the features a smart OUTLET like this has, like turning things on/off automatic scheduling, and you can move this anywhere for any appliance or idea you can think of. Obviously, the smart bulb has to be in a light source. They were super simple to set up (download the "Kasa TP-Link" app on your phone), hit the power button on the side of the outlet after plugging in, and follow the easy prompts on the app. The end. Google Assistant (Google Home, or on your phone, or chromebook, or anywhere you have Assistant) works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E.

customer_reviews.title: So Glad I Purchased These!
customer_reviews.text: Love the easy integration to Alexa and the app itself is relatively easy to navigate. I am currently using these for outdoor lights. They are perfect for timed lighting and versatility. You can keep it horizontally or change to vertical. Definitely glad I purchased these!
customer_reviews.author: Hector Pedraza

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link broke HomeKit integration promise!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these smart plugs with the understanding that TP-Link would be adding HomeKit support in the near future. While these devices work fine with Alexa, I have a mixed Apple/Alexa environment and TP-Link previously announced in January 2019 that HomeKit integration would be added this year. Now, several months later, they have changed their minds. Is HomeKit a requirement? No. Do I trust a company that sells devices with a promise that they readily break? No. I will not be purchasing any more of these plugs and will search elsewhere for plugs that meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: First time using smart plugs, i dont have a echo nor google assistant. Very impressed with the product. Basically if you dont have a echo or google assistant, you simply download the app, sync the plug with your wifi, and your all set. Probably took me less than 5 minutes to set up. Right now i'm just using it for a lamp, but app is great in which you can set up times when to turn on/off, i also like how it keeps track of how long it was on, how much energy it uses, etc. highly recommend, dont need to be experienced in tech to set up, anyone can do.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great little WiFi plug
customer_reviews.text: This is a great improvement over prior WiFi plugs that were large and bulky. This easily fits in a power strip or on an outlet, leaving room for access to other outlets. It was very easy to set up with the Kasa app and showed up in my Google Home app soon afterward. I use them to control a floor lamp and also to control the Christmas tree lights and bells during the holidays. It was fun to program Google Home to respond to the command "Let's get Christmasy" and have it turn on the tree lights and start playing Christmas tunes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Should be called a dumb plug
customer_reviews.text: I bought this plug for the timer function. My idea was this: plug the old coffee maker I love in to it and program it to automatically shutoff after 15 minutes so that I don't burn the house down. I know, it seems as though that's a great implementation of the timer feature. But that's apparently too smart for it. You see what you have to do is turn the thing on, then go into the app and set a timer every time you use it. That is very dumb, and it directly defeats the whole idea. If I'm going to remember to go in and set a timer, what's the point? Epic fail, returned.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: No Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Installed four TP-Link Smart plugs. Install with the Kasa app made for an easy setup. After two weeks various plugs began losing contact with the Kasa app. Alexa could not communicate with the plugs. Contacted tech support, was sent an email asking six questions. Sent back reply and have yet to get a solution. Tech support is non existent.
customer_reviews.author: James Messina

customer_reviews.title: Finally figured out the problem - update review
customer_reviews.text: I am updating my review from 1 star to 4 stars. User error on my part. I typically turn off my wi-fi's connection overnight to save the battery. I'd wake up in the morning to all the smart plugs not responding. Then a week later, I had an idea. I now leave the wi-fi engaged on my phone all the time, and the smart plugs stay connected. Now my battery drops during the day, but I have my lights available when I need them. Maybe this is obvious, but there is nothing in the install directions that told me to keep the wi-fi engaged. Okay, i get that now.
customer_reviews.author: GreenMtnDoll

customer_reviews.title: I thought they were great!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to control my flood lights around the house. There has been an increase in burglaries and hold ups in my area. I usually come home late at night from work and I thought if I had these installed I can turn on my lights around the house as a deterrent for unwanted visitors. Boy was I wrong after installed them and did the firmware updates they don't work as they should. I would use my phone to turn them on but its always a hit and miss. Sometimes I the app would indicate that they are on but when you look the lights are off. I need something that is reliable and this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Anslem John

customer_reviews.title: would not integrate with anything other than its own app
customer_reviews.text: wifi signal was great and the unit seemed to function well with its own app; however, it would not connect with anything else so you have to open up the app to do anything with the device. i can do that with the remote controls. i tried all day to connect it and called tech support from both tplink (who makes this) and my device i was connecting to and both support centers kept saying the problem was not theirs and to call the other one. I'm not going to run in circles trying to get this to work when it should work out of the box like everything else. sending it back since it doesn't integrate as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and use
customer_reviews.text: Like many others I bought several of these products over the years. These were bought several months ago at a great price from the Treasure Truck! I would pay full price for these items without hesitation. Very easy to install after uploading the app. Able to easily program off/on lights and they work without any problems. I was so impressed by Kasa I eventually bought their light bulb and, most recently, the indoor security camera. Very happy with purchases.
customer_reviews.author: BronxxGirl

customer_reviews.title: Nice WiFi plugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of double Kasa Smart WiFi plugs for security lighting and a Spot camera. I liked them, so added a pair of Kasa Smart WiFi Plug Minis. I put these on a couple of power strips with chargers, etc., that were hard to reach to turn on/off. Saves my back. After adding an Echo Dot, all our Kasa WiFi plugs easily work with Alexa. Now I don't even have to get my phone out ... I can ask Alexa to turn the lights/chargers on/off, even from another room. (Still working out schedules that Alexa will work with.)
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: Don't change your wifi and your fine.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a while but then ran into a million issues when I changed my wifi when we moved. It now won't connect to my wifi, nor my phone. I've tried troubleshooting everything 10x. The app is pretty much crap when it comes to self service help. Due to its horrendous size, I've decided to toss it and go to my Amazon plugs which I can always count on. I don't recommend this device any more, it's pretty out dated and not space efficient.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: maybe look into another brand
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning these. I thought they would be good but they would also go offline and need to be reset/re enabled in the app. It was a giant annoyance and they were unreliable for when I wanted to use the app feature from my phone. No firmware update available either to fix the issues, hence the return.
customer_reviews.author: Kt

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have used lots of different smart home devices and plugs. We recently changed internet providers at our apartment and the router only outputs 5ghz. I had a couple of different brands of cheap smart plugs and they would not connect. My Kasa plugs had zero issue connecting so I just bought another set and couldn't be happier. They aren't huge. The android app makes them very easy to setup and my Alexa devices immediately communicated no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Really like them
customer_reviews.text: I love both the light switches and plugs. The plugs are very easy to set up (I had my contractor brother install the light switches). Both products are performing very well! I love that I can turn them on manually within the app as well as set them to a schedule. Will continue to collect them until the entire house is equipped with them. Just waiting for double and triple light switches and I would love it if the plugs were a tiny but smaller (aren’t we all so picky?!) Still, well made and very convenient. I am very happy with these purchases and will continue to buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: K Powell

customer_reviews.title: not to be used for computers...computer keeps on rebooting
customer_reviews.text: overall, it's a good smart plug to be used with google home and amazon's echo. however, it seems to be very sensitive to even the slightest power fluctuation. i had one hooked up for use with a desktop computer with the intention of remotely turning it on. but during the day, my computer would restart several time on its own due to it being connected to this plug. my computer is not particularly power hungry. if this device can handle up to 10 amps, it should be able to handle 3 amps used by my computer. but my computer keeps rebooting while on this smart plug. use it for lights and fans, but avoid using it for computers.
customer_reviews.author: rem736

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to replace a belkin wemo switch that died. The wemo was a nightmare to set up when I purchased it, but they have improved it quite a bit since then. Having said that, it didn't last very long, so I wasn't going to purchase another. I was impressed with how easy these were to set up. I had no issues at all (my router is also a TP-Link, which probably helps). I have them set up to operate lamps, so nothing complicated. They appear to work perfectly with Alexa. I'll update this review if anything changes, but so far I'm very pleased. Hopefully they will last longer than my wemo switch.
customer_reviews.author: 64BakerStreet

customer_reviews.title: Handy Little Gadgets – Especially for Home Security When You're Away
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! We used these to control lights and radios throughout the house while we were on vacation. We thought we'd have to remember to turn devices on and off while we were gone, but these little Smart Plugs are programmable. We set some lights for specific times and others for "random." We tested them for two days before we left, and they did what they were supposed to do. We especially appreciate the "random" feature, because anyone watching the house would notice that lights and music come on and go off and different times throughout the day. Can't do that with a rotary timer! We're glad we bought these, and we recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky Fran

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Delivery took the total estimated time. It is as described a pair of mini WiFi plugs. No hub is required. Downloaded the control app from TP-Link to my Android tablet. During the first connection to setup a plug the plug is an access point so the tablet was connected to the plug's WiFI. Then entered the local SSID and password via the app. The plug then connected to the my network. The app provides for naming each plug and setting up a schedule for each plug. A group con be created so that both plugs can use the same schedule. I do not use Alexa or Google assistant.
customer_reviews.author: tigerg

customer_reviews.title: Great plug, Small profile
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a number of smart plugs. These are my favorite due to the size/profile. I am able to stack these plugs above one another in a double gang box (4 outlets) without blocking the other plug stack. This was key for me. My second choice, the amazon smart plug, was too wide and rendered the adjunct plugs unusable.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Constant disconnects during setup was enough to return these
customer_reviews.text: I bought two 2-packs. During setup, it was next to impossible to go through the setup process in the app. Maybe it was the Christmas rush destroying the servers, but I already owned some WEMO switches. So I went out to Costco, bought some of those and was able to set them up without issue. Sent back the TP-link switches. I'm sure these work fine if you can get them set up, but ain't nobody got time for bad servers or apps. Took away 2 stars since it's not fair to say these don't work...but fair because I wasn't able to set them up to verify that.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleSwade

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup reliable smart plug.
customer_reviews.text: This wifi plug wasn't difficult to set up and it paired very easily. I like that it doesn't prevent you from using the open receptacle or prevent you from using 2 in the same receptacle. The app is straight forward with an easy layout making it a cinch to setup. I think this is a bit pricey but only once did Alexa have a problem communicating with my furthest smart plug, so the quality is there. I particularly like that this plug is rated the same as the receptacle that it's plugged into. Overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carl B

customer_reviews.title: These devices are really nice. These arrived today and in less than 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: These devices are really nice.These arrived today and in less than 5 minutes they were up and working. Pairing with Alexa was flawless. You can set schedules for then so they can turn lights on and off. Our Alexa is right by the front door and when entering late at night we can just tell Alexa to turn on the lights and our path is lit all the way upstairs. In the morning during winter we use an Echo Dot upstairs to turn the lights on. So easy. We love these little gems! Would buy again and probably will.
customer_reviews.author: Never Lost Again!

customer_reviews.title: Great device controlling plugs
customer_reviews.text: The set up on these is exceptionally easy. Once connected they stay connected. I have moved them around or left them unplugged several times with no issues. I love how they do not take up the entire outlet either. They look very nice also. My only issue is the blue light is rather bright so if you have trouble sleeping with any light in the room, either don't use it in the bedroom or make sure it is obscured when you are sleeping. I use mine with my Alexas. I have bought several more since my initial purchase. Highly recommend if smart control using Alexa is your thing.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia94

customer_reviews.title: YUP!
customer_reviews.text: These are the shiznit... I like these better than the lightbulbs because they're simply more versatile and they are more cost effective. I can control a lot with these. The APP is pretty logical, and common sense based. We use these for when we are on holiday. I have one in each room and set them all to a different schedule to make it apear that someone is moving from room to room. Our home is in a rough neighborhood and we've had no issues when we've been gone. Im quite impressed to be honest and Im picky...
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Life got easier ...
customer_reviews.text: Using one for aquarium lights in my fish room. The other to power a lamp in the corner of that fish room. Aquarium lights are now on a schedule for consistent on and off and if I wanted could be based on current daylight hours. That could become useful down the road. The lamp is in an aukward corner where access is inconvenient. Not anymore. Can turn it on remotely with my phone prior to entering. Later turn it off remotely if I inadvertently forgot to turn it off. Possibilities around the house are limitless. Getting more along with light switches to automate my home.
customer_reviews.author: GARRIGA

customer_reviews.title: Research paid off, product works!
customer_reviews.text: I have several products from this company. Light switches, and of course these smart plugs. After my initial purchase, and the ease of setup and seamless integration with my Alexa, I had to buy more. I have units in several states, and use the app to turn on and off devices remotely. Their app was better than others I had tried, and the ability to set up timers and schedules makes my property look inhabited. I have it set so that lights appear to follow an invisible person as they walk through the house. Pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smarhome - YES!
customer_reviews.text: Love these KASA smartplugs for my home. I wanted easy integration for network without a hub and these easily satisfy my needs. Work perfectly for Halloween/Christmas time when I need to set a schedule for them to turn on/off lights. I also enjoy the Google Home integration that I can say "turn-on Christmas tree" and it does so. Easy to install, navigate and setup up scheduling all from the app. And as long as I have power/internet in my home, I can access remotely anytime. I have made 15 purchases of these along with their light-bulbs. Love the quality at cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Contini

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and program. Bought my first one when Amazon offered it for $5 as part of an Echo Dot bundle. Liked it so much that I bought several more to control my outside Christmas lights. Didn't even bother to look for alternates. Now I can turn them on and off even when I am traveling. I highly recommended them. Still haven't been able to determine whether the plug retains schedules during a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Calidas

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I set up one of these to run my Christmas tree and the other to run a space heater in my bathroom. It's funny to see the look on people's faces when I say "Alexa, turn on the tree" and our tree lights up! The other use is just perfect for cold mornings. I have Alexa turn on my manual space heater and I don't' even have to get out of bed! 5 min later I get up and start getting ready for work and my bathroom is nice and toasty.
customer_reviews.author: 86Fiero

customer_reviews.title: Work great with Google
customer_reviews.text: These work perfect with google. I have several smart plugs, these are by far the best size and shape. They don't takeover the entire socket or plug like some other brands/styles.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I set a schedule to turn on & off lamp. It worked for 2 days. I tried everything. I reset it, uninstalled and reinstalled app, rebooted router. Contacted the help by text which was useless as I had to end the text to use the app to redo everything again and it would get a blue signal, it would say everything was ready yet Alexa couldn’t find it and it wouldn’t turn on or off light. There is no phone number to call for support only text. I packaged it back up and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Hemmerich

customer_reviews.title: A consistently positive smart home line for us
customer_reviews.text: TP-Link Kasa has been a consistently positive smart home line for us since we bought into an Echo/Alexa home. When we are not barking at Echo, we manage all of our smart plugs, switches, bulbs, etc. through one integrated TP-Link app, by design, and it makes for an awesome user experience. The app has all the schedule/timer/smart functions you could desire, and everything consistently works. This product is no exception. Not one issue at any point!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: So handy!
customer_reviews.text: My boys have 2 lava lamps in their room that they like to put on at night when they are going to sleep. Every night, my husband or I would have to go to the back of the dressers to turn them off. Now, I have them both plugged into an extension cord from one of these mini outlets and all I have to do is ask Alexa to turn off the lava lamps for me. Installation was a piece of cake. I plugged it in, installed the Kasa app on my phone and everything synced right up. Then, I enabled the skill in my alexa app.
customer_reviews.author: S. Manning

customer_reviews.title: Kasa are the worst in connecting and installing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these in December and i have to reset the device every week. And sometimes it will not even connect after resetting. It will not even allow to do a firmware update. After resetting the device I'll get a message that the device firmware needs to update but it fails every time because it will not maintain a connection. The device is 18" from the router. I even dedicated an IP on the router for it. It still fails. It is just an expensive piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, no maintenance.  Also, a great and fast API for developers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for my Mother In Law last Christmas, and she uses it every day. Easy to set up and not a single issue or complaint. I recommend this product if you're looking for something that's easy to set up and requires no maintenance or troubleshooting. I also bought a handful of these so I could utilize their API and write some applications to control it. API is very speedy (each request took about 500ms - which given it has to flip a physical switch on the device, is very fast). Highly recommended if you're a software developer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Loses network connection A LOT
customer_reviews.text: One of two of these plugs keeps losing network connection. Worked fine for several weeks. After that, I keep having to connect to the network several times a week. This one is close the the floor. The other one (it was a 2-pack) mostly works. I have had to reconnect that at least once. Overall, I'm going to be looking for another product.
customer_reviews.author: s593tp

customer_reviews.title: Great for the christmas tree
customer_reviews.text: We use a google integrated smart home system and it was very easy to setup and use with it. I already had a few Kasa items in our system so adding a few more was a breeze. I really like the convenience of being able to tell google to turn on our christmas tree and our kids love to be able to turn it on too. Of course you can always set a schedule so you don't even have to tell google to turn on the tree, but we are so used to asking google to do things, it is almost second nature to us.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Very good plugs!
customer_reviews.text: The plugs so far are better than any other smart plug I've used. They seem to respond much quicker through my Google Home setup. They also work with my "blended network" setup. I've only had them for 2 days but they so far have gone above and beyond what I expected. The only negative is that they don't track energy usage, but that might not be a con for everybody depending on what you want to use them for.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Very good smart-plugs that work really well with Echo decices and iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: I love these plugs and have them through-out my house! These are a huge improvement over theor 1st gen plugs that blocked the second outlet. I will still use those where possible, but these are the ones ro get! When I first started using KASA outlets, the connectivity with my Echo devices, and even my iPhone, failed a few times. But KASA’s customer service was awesome and they generally put out notices and corrected the problem immediately. They seem to have kicked those glitches because I have not had that problem in a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: JeanneTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Presents
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my sisters for Christmas and they use them all the time. I have some of my own. I do have some issues where I have to reset them from time to time which can be annoying because you are constantly trying to figure out how to get them back up and working which is why I rated them 4 stars and not 5. When they are working...man it is nice.
customer_reviews.author: George T.

customer_reviews.title: Best smart lighting options
customer_reviews.text: Been putting these tp link products throughout my house specifically for lighting. I love my setup and the functionality. These are easy to install and the features are great. I’ll mention they’re bulkier than standard lights so a little difficult to push in, but that’s a minor thing. I use the timers every day, Alexa connection I cling scenes for going to bed, away mode, and turning off the lights if I ever forget.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew  Harnden

customer_reviews.title: No luck with the pair I bought
customer_reviews.text: As with other reviews, the two pack I got started losing connectivity with my WiFi a month after installing them. Has happened several times now and it’s both at the same time in different parts of the house. All other 2.4gh devices I’m using work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: J Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Parents Love It
customer_reviews.text: We bought my parents a Google Home for Christmas and we wanted to give them some gadgets to go with it. After getting their Google set up, we hooked these up and it was easy as pie. Download the app, plug in the outlet, connect to wi-fi, finish set-up. They hooked it up to their Christmas tree for now but were already making plans for how they could use it afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: amowrey715

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They work great and I have never had any issues! They are very easy to work with and create timers and schedules with! I live in an older house so I have some wired areas that require me to turn on a light in order to use the outlet. This allows me to control that light rather then taking the bulbs out. I also use these for my patio lights, setting schedules are easy and you never will forget again to turn your lights out!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bolyard

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi Switches.
customer_reviews.text: I used these Kasa mini plugs on all my lamps throughout the house. I have changed all of my switches to Kasa switches. That is, with the exception of 7 fan switches that provide light control and fan speed control. If Kasa where to offer a fan on/off/3-speed fan control only switch, I would replace the seven fan switches. I already control the lights on the fans with Kasa Light switches, so a fan control switch would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Vogt

customer_reviews.title: Just not right for me
customer_reviews.text: They seemed like they would be great for managing lights while away on vacation. With my older Apple Time Machine I could just not get them to get on the 2.4 band. Which the Apple unit supposedly does have, dual band and all that. Did a lot of things in the controls but just couldn't make it happen. Returning them for that reason only.
customer_reviews.author: SuzanP

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy
customer_reviews.text: Bought these twice having thought the first time was a defective device and both times they just would not connect to my wifi. I have connected devices throughout my house INCLUDING one of these from an earlier purchase and they just wouldn't connect. Not saying they're no good, but be ready for a lot of grief if they don't connect the first time. Returned for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Knell

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Plug. Works with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a smaller plug from TPlink. I use this in conjunction with the usual lamp light source, but also with my Foscam IP cameras. Sometimes, some of my aging Foscam cameras will need to be rebooted, and this allows me to reboot them remotely. The uptime for TP-link Smart plugs (both the original oval shaped ones and this) has been 100% for me. Very reliable. For your consideration, I have had them for about 3mths - 1 year so far. As usual, Alexa integration is seamless and painless by enabling the KASA skill on Alexa App and click on "Discover".
customer_reviews.author: K Co.

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best items I bought off of Amazon. I can turn on and off the lights when I'm not home. I usually set schedules for my lights. When I'm gone for a lot of days I set a schedule so it looks like I'm home. I like setting a timer and not having to get up out of bed or I could set the timer set the lights turned on so I can motivate myself to get up out of bed. It's mostly helpful because the studio I live in doesn't actually have a light switch but now I have a light switch from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: McD

customer_reviews.title: Setup process never succeeded; poor app
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product a few days ago. Have been trying to set up for over an hour. Downloaded manual/userguide. No help. App itself has no useful feedback regarding where the setup is failing - just prompts me to start over, again and again. NOT A GOOD EXPERIENCE!
customer_reviews.author: P. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Simple and reliable after 1 year of use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a year now as timers for my aquarium lights (Daily on/off schedules). The setup was straight forward. Basic operation through the Google Home app is fine, but it's much easier to use the outlets via the the Kasa app. The outlets have automatically applied updates. It's nice having a company backing the product and updating both the outlets' firmware and phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Hoa

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: One of the two units came with outdated firmware and it was a bit of a bear getting it updated. Once done, they has been working like a champ. I now have three of these running with no issues. I also have a Wemo, and I like the TP-Link MUCH better. The Wemo cannot recover from a power failure and must be manually reconfigured which is a royal pain. The TP-L:ink recovers quickly and seamlessly. Also, the TP-Link seems to grab my Wi-Fi signal without issue wherever in the house I've tried it, unlike the Wemo that has connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Serious User

customer_reviews.title: Awesome smart plugs
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these hooked up in my house, and they are very easy to use. Right now, one is used for the Christmas tree, so I don't have to go behind the tree to plug/unplug the lights. It took a few minutes to set them up with my lenovo smart display, and they work every time. I also like that I can set a custom timer schedule from my iPhone and have lights on when I get home in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Josh G.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 weeks then burned out
customer_reviews.text: I loved these smart plugs and have several types throughout my two homes. I bought two more to control a couple fo lights for the holidays. This one was a two pack. One of them worked for less than three weeks then just stopped. Only way I can explain is it seems like it burned out. No light, it doesn’t reset, etc. Very dissatisfied with quality.
customer_reviews.author: GalAboutTown

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection regularly
customer_reviews.text: At first the tp-link plugs worked well. Six months later, I can’t get these things to stay connected to my WiFi. And they’re close to my really good WiFi wireless router!
customer_reviews.author: Tim B.

customer_reviews.title: Setup is a cinch plus home assistant connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I love these. We have a bunch of both the older, tear-drop-shaped versions and the newer ones. Adding units to the app is simple and assuming you have the app synced to your Alexa (or whatever), you can then control everything with your voice. Obviously you can also control the switches from your phone with the Kasa app, or manually by just pressing the button on the side of the unit. Super handy and it's nice to be able to walk in the door and say, "Alexa, turn on the corner light."
customer_reviews.author: Sean Curry

customer_reviews.title: Difficult setup, low range
customer_reviews.text: I was intrigued by this product and thought it would go well with my dad’s Alexa. The setup on this is ridiculous. Download an app, then have it connected to WiFi, then jump through another 2 hoops... Only for it to not even connect for an entire day. I was disappointed in the range - you have to be pretty close to the router for it to do anything/register. Once we moved some things around the house (again, super inconvenient to have to do) they worked fine. My dad enjoys them, but wishes he didn’t have to move his items around the house for these to work. I wouldn’t recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Handy plug
customer_reviews.text: Great plugs. Takes a little bit to get them integrated but pretty much step by step. Only have had to rest one once so no real issues on reliability. Biggest issue is so many items are getting away from the mechanical power button. So you can get power but you now need to turn it on. Main uses have been Christmas lights and lamps.
customer_reviews.author: David McMahon

customer_reviews.title: I could get spoiled with these
customer_reviews.text: I bought two if these, one for my simple, no- frills Mr. Coffee, the other for a living room lamp. I like them so much I tell Alexa to turn on my lamp just for the pleasure of watching it go off and on. (I'm not doing it for hours on end or anything, just once or twice a day. ) I'll be purchasing more, and looking into smart bulbs as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pj Coffman

customer_reviews.title: I have had good success with these Smart Plug minis
customer_reviews.text: I have had good success with these Smart Plug minis. Over a year since my first purchase and now have 3 of them n the house and no problems. Just follow the instructions, download the app, name the device and you should be good to go. My Alexa turns stuff on and off without problems. I sometimes have to tell Alexa a command twice, but that maybe her and not the smart plugs. Also like being able to turn stuff on remotely via my smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: War eagle

customer_reviews.title: excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: i originally ordered a new product but received an unboxed product which was probably a renewed item but they refunded my purchase and allowed me to keep the items which i am using and seem to work as described so far this is very respectable and gives me confidence for future purchases from this source i have been using for at least 2 weeks now and now going to buy more
customer_reviews.author: JBueno

customer_reviews.title: I purchased these plugs as an alternative to smart bulbs for several lamps in my room
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these plugs as an alternative to smart bulbs for several lamps in my room. The on/off button is hard to reach in certain places and this was a perfect way to control the lighting. This works especially well for the lights that do not have bulbs but small LEDs. I really love how I can remotely turn on/off the plugs. Pairing was super easy, and even easier with Google Assistant. Now I can control the lighting via plug switch, the app, and by google voice! I highly recommend this over the smart bulbs as these last longer and offer more flexibility in how you use them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in conjunction with Amazon Alexa and they are awesome. I use one them both to turn on lamps. I can also use the app to make sure they are off when I am not home. I recommend these for anyone who wants a (semi) smart house! I have another brand of the same product and it is big and bulky and takes up both outlets on a plug but these are small enough where you could use and and still have access to the other outlet. The pairing of the devices is so easy, you just have to touch a few buttons and know your WiFi password.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Great device.  Not all similar products are UL approved.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. It has a cool online feature that allows randomized usage during a travel mode that you configure. So instead of a "dumb" timer that goes on and off at the same time, it randomizes it during a window of time. I wish they had an iPhone widget for the interface, so turning on and off could be even easier, but their app is more than good enough for the job. Watch out for other devices that aren't UL approved.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: This products works well and is very easy to install. Even though the instruction tells you that you need to be connected to a 2.4 wifi to make this work, it install easily even when your on the 5ghz wifi. Most products suffer fro this install process but this product went well. The main reason I bought this product is because this smart plug will go back to it's original status after a power outage. If the smart plug was in the ON status before the power outage, it will return to the ON status after the power is restored. There is no setting to make this happen, it just does it by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi plugs.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these plugs for about a month now and I couldn't be happier. The app is extremely easy to use. It recognizes the new plugs without any complicated steps. Setting on/ off times within the app is a nice feature. Turing the plugs on and off in the app is easy enough, however, telling Alexa to do it is easier still. Truthfully, I have zero complaints. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JTB

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These took less than a minute to set up and work perfectly with Alexa. I used these for lamps with multiple fixtures rather than buying a smartlight for each individual bulb. The only negative is that those lights can't be dimmed like the smartlights, but the cost difference was worth it for me (I'm just including this as an FYI to anyone who wondered if it would work - the product does not claim to be able to dim lights). I will definitely purchase again when I decide to expand my smart home devices.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Makes life very easy and simple for anything electric that needs a timer or schedule.
customer_reviews.text: I love these plugs. Great for anything you need a timer for. You can set a schedule for them to turn on and off. I have a multitude of appliances using them from grow lights and xmas tree lights to yankee wax smelters to name a few. Plug them in, download the app, activate them, set the schedule you desire and forget about them. Very user friendly app on my android device- also compatible with Alexa but I haven't activated it yet with her, she already does enough in my house so I kept the Kasa stuff separate.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great way to start turning your home into a smart home!
customer_reviews.text: Update: One of the plugs has stopped being able to connect to our internet. The help site through the app was worthless! Think we will be getting a different brand next time! These work great with Alexa devices! I have these hooked up to my son’s lamp and my living room lamp and they both work great! Picks up WIFI with no problems whatsoever! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M.K. 17

customer_reviews.title: Only works with mobile device or voice, no network/web interface
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping to turn on my 3D printer remotely, so it would only be running when I set it a job. Sadly, despite "No Hub Required" and being "Wi-Fi enabled" it only works with designated voice assistants and their own mobile phone app. While it does appear to work acceptably on the limited devices supported, the lack of direct connectivity on the local network is pretty disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Overzeetop

customer_reviews.title: They turn off when they shouldn't
customer_reviews.text: I received that smart plug which I bought to set as automatic turn on 17.:45 and turn off 23:45 my Christmas lights. They turned on automatically but after a few minutes they turned off. I turned them back on with the App and again they turned of after a short while. I ended up doing what I wanted to avoid, which was to have to b turning on and off the Christmas lights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These make me so lazy and life easier...
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love these smart plugs. I hooked them up to my google home as well and all I need to say is "hey google, turn on...." and let there be light. They have made me so lazy :) The app is also super easy to navigate and I love that I can set a timer for a lamp to go on in the morning or night for my dog so they aren't sitting in the dark at home. They are also so easy to install. I'm in love with these little smart plugs.
customer_reviews.author: melissa8076

customer_reviews.title: The easiest set up ever
customer_reviews.text: I really like this company's products. I have several of their full size plugs that I bought a few years ago. These new minis are even nicer. They plug in and leave the second plug open now (unlike their older bigger ones) and literally, it took 30 seconds to get them going. I liked that I just had to add it via the Kasa app and not go through connecting to the device directly etc ... like many of these IoT things do. I just want to find more places to use them and buy a few more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: my son thinks he can perform magic
customer_reviews.text: i have had several app controlled outlets and I really enjoy how smooth this app works. Was able to get connected to my wifi within less than a minute. The schedule is quick and easy to set up also. I have about 5 of these set up for items around the house. side note. I have a little Christmas tree in my sons room each year around the Holiday. I use the app to turn on and off the tree when he says the "magic words" and he is so amazed that he is the only one with the magical powers in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great plug, returning others!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They work with my scentsy warmers, I set up a routine so they just run a couple hours every night! I'm really bad at remembering to turn them off, so this is going to fix that problem! I tried other smart plug before this and it kept kicking off, so I want to state that this one does NOT have that problem!!
customer_reviews.author: golni5

customer_reviews.title: Works great, enough room without blocking all the outelts
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much perfect - I can use them stand-alone with the Kasa app or by using an Alexa-enabled skill. The Kasa app also allows you to set timers and schedules. These are the better version because they are small enough where they will not block multiple outlets. I have had these for about 7 months and had to re-set them up once when the scheduling function in Kasa wouldn't work, but have otherwise had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Diem

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very technical but I do like current technology. The Kasa indoor plugs worked so well I decided to try the outdoor plug. I worried that the WIFI signal strength would be too weak even with my extender. Instructions were great and the plugs paired up with the Kasa App and my home alexas devices without any problem. The outdoor plug worked like a charm - I think the WIFI extender helped. Be sure to decide on a name for the plug before you add the device...use the APP to name or rename your smart devices.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Vega

customer_reviews.title: These are the best! So far.
customer_reviews.text: This product blows that lame company Belkin Wemo out of the water! Connection is always great and I never lose connection or does the IOS App ever tell me that it can't find the device. Hooked this puppy up to my Alexa Echo and Dot and it's sooooo much fun to turn on the lights. I bought 10 of these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bui

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive to power and internet outages
customer_reviews.text: Every time the power or internet goes out expect to have to reset these plugs. Prepare to get down on your hands and knees. Not sure if all similar products act this way but with today's tech one would think they not have to be reset.
customer_reviews.author: 1X2X4

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: These plugs are wonderful. They JUST WORK. I've used the Android app for remote control, integrated with my Google Home, and set schedules and it all worked fabulously. I bought these after a miserable experience with theand searching online for a couple weeks. None of the above features worked with the Etekcity product, even though the reviews are so positive for it. This Kasa plug is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stewart

customer_reviews.title: These work when the competitions didnt
customer_reviews.text: I tried a competitor product that did work so well that led me these made by Kasa and I couldn't be happier. They work great! In fact I don't want to jinx myself but I have yet to have a single problem with my Kasa Smart Plugs since installation. My best advice is this "They Simply Work".
customer_reviews.author: Handi-man

customer_reviews.title: Great, reliable plugs
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic. I've got about a dozen or so that are 1-2 years old. I've never had an issue with them. They connect reliably to WiFi (I do have a route on each of the 3 levels of my 3000 sqft home). I don't use the Kasa app, I instead use HomeBridge for Apple Home support. Alexa integration is fantastic also.
customer_reviews.author: T. Harper

customer_reviews.title: These work reliably
customer_reviews.text: I began a smart home upgrade by buying a few items from a few different companies. All of the products I bought from TP-Link, including these switches, work wonderfully. Of the products I bought from GE, two failed within the firs couple weeks, and two others have required several resets and reprogramming efforts. From now on, I plan to only buy TP-Link products for my smart home.
customer_reviews.author: RobertP

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: These things only work when they want to. They frequently disconnect from the internet. Now I’m dealing with the scheduled timer not working. I have my living room lamp scheduled to turn on at 6pm, but it turns on around 8pm instead, if it turns on at all. So frustrating!! Reconfiguring doesn’t even help.
customer_reviews.author: AlyssaMarieBeauty

customer_reviews.title: Two in one outlet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite smart plug. The TP-Link Smart Plug Mini is very easy to set up, program and use. You can set a timer, you can program and away schedule, you can control with voice through Alexa apps as well as the Kasa app. I can even check my plugs from away from home and turn on and off while gone. This mini form factor works great, so you can have two of these in the same outlet if you wish.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite smart plug
customer_reviews.text: My favorite smart plug, I have many other versions of Smart plug that I bought before these but now I will only buy these. The others take a dual outlet and make one of the outlets inoperable as they cover it so much that you can't use it with any plug (even the small ones with two contacts). These are great because you can use two in the same outlet or you can still use the other outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: These will set up with an Android tablet!
customer_reviews.text: These actually work with my Samsung tablet (I don't have a smartphone). So now I have them set up to come on at sunset and go off at bedtime. I can turn on or off my lamp with Alexa and I am happy. The other set I got (different manufacturer) would not work with a tablet, only a smart phone. So I could not get them set up and ultimately not get them connected to Alexa. Quite happy. Contemplating buying one of the energy monitoring units. I thought about a meter but for a little more I could have a smart plug and a monitor in one.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Installation is a simple as plugging these in, then plugging a device to them. The iPhone app makes the setup a snap 1) Turn device on 2) Connect phone to the device's wireless network (temporarily) 3) Answer a couple of question (device type, name, location, and your home wifi network) 4) That's it!
customer_reviews.author: Bado

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love them! It’s a 2 pack. I’ve got one in the living room and one in a bedroom. I turn either or both on whenever I want and I have both on a schedule. I like that I can turn them on when I’m otw home so there’s lights on when I get there. Easy to follow instructions and if you can’t install the plugs, you shouldn’t be buying much of anything. A potato could set these things up!
customer_reviews.author: Lregister

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart WiFi Plug Mini by TP-Link – Smart Plug, No Hub Required, Works with Alexa and Google (HS105 KIT)
product_meta.description: Control lighting and other appliances from anywhere with the Kasa Smart Wi-Fi Plug mini. Schedule connected devices turn on when you get home, then power down when you go to sleep. Control each outlet individually or as one, set schedules or scenes, even use voice commands with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, or Microsoft Cortana. Protocols Supported: IEEE 802.11b/g/n; System Requirement: Android 4.1 or higher iOS 9 or higher; Wireless Type: 2.4 GHz 1T1R.
feature_bullets: Control from anywhere: Turn electronics on or off from anywhere with your smartphone using the Kasa app (compatible w/ android & ios)
Voice Control: Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and Microsoft Cortana supported devices for a hands free experience
Compact Design: Won't block the other wall outlet allowing two Smart plugs to be installed side by side
Kasa scenes & schedules: Schedule the Smart plug to automatically switch on and off when away or set a scene for controlling many devices with a single button
Note: 2 Pack Includes (2) Smart plugs; Requires a Secured 2.4 gigahertz wifi network connection

specifications.Included Components: Smart Wi-Fi Plug Mini HS105 * 2, Quick Start Guide
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,984 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
